channel.title: Can't log onto ANY server, is it router related?
channel.description:
Basically I can't log onto ANY server, including one I make with the "Start Server" option. I think I have the basics of using MoparScape, from what I've already read, but I still can't log onto ANY server at all. The only thing I can think of from my limited experience with servers and IPs, etc. is that my router may be messing something up. Would I need to forward some ports or something? Some other people seem to be having the same problem, so is it possible there is an issue with MoparScape?
Also, I do have the latest version of Java (6.0). I know a fair bit of Java so I'm excited about the possibilities and want to get this working as soon as possible.

item.title: Can't log onto ANY server, is it router related?
item.dc:creator: @Mophed Mophed
item.description:
@Mophed wrote:

I said this in my first post: I have the latest Java release. I work with Java a lot so I’ve had the latest version since day 1.

As far as I know there have been no updates to JDK 6… there is a pre-release binary snapshot of JDK 7, but that’s still in development, so I’m pretty sure that’s not what you mean, is it?

Thanks for the responses though![br][size=1]Posted on: January 31, 2007, 09:44:10 PM[/size][hr][quote=“T3h Hate, post:6, topic:52607”]It is the router then.[/quote]
That really helps. Thanks a whole lot![/sarcasm]

Seriously, do you know how to fix it or do you just want to tell me what’s wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Can't log onto ANY server, is it router related?
item.dc:creator: @Mophed Mophed
item.description:
@Mophed wrote:

Ok, I’ll try hamachi…

@dds ya dead: I downloaded the client and have tried using the webclient. Both give the same results.

EDIT: Hamachi didn’t do anything… I still can’t access any servers.[br][size=1]Posted on: January 28, 2007, 09:01:34 PM[/size][hr]Bumping again…

EDIT: I have some more information. When I try joining a server for the first time (Hybrid or other server) it says: “Couldn’t create directory logs.”
